glsa.title: NUT: Arbitrary code execution
glsa.synopsis: A buffer overflow in NUT might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.

background.p: The Network UPS Tools (NUT) provide support for power devices.

description.p: An error in the addchar() function in parseconf.c may cause a buffer overflow.

impact.p: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted string to upsd, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All NUT users should upgrade to the latest version:
